responses: Bradley's portfolio is built with React.js on the front end and Flask in the backend.

Exploring Bradley's portfolio will give you insights into his skills and projects.

patterns: Tell me about Bradley's work experience
responses: Bradley is a fourth-year Computer Science student with a minor in Data Science at the University of Ottawa.
He has worked on projects involving passwordless authentication, web applications for financial institutions, and workshops on deploying applications on private cloud.
Bradley has experience with database management at CMiC, data integration mappings, and automation with API testing and scripting.
In his career, Bradley has contributed to various impactful projects, showcasing his skills in full-stack development and machine learning.

patterns: Tell me about Bradley's GitHub projects
responses: You can find Bradley's GitHub and explore his projects at https://github.com/bradley121901.
Explore Bradley's GitHub repositories at https://github.com/bradley121901.
Bradley's GitHub is a hub for his projects, covering machine learning, full-stack development, Flask, Django, HTML, React.js, Node.js, MongoDB, MySQL, and Android.
Visit Bradley's GitHub at https://github.com/bradley121901 to discover his coding expertise across various technologies.

Bradley is passionate about impactful development and has experience with cutting-edge technologies.
He enjoys exploring and contributing to impressive repositories and strives to become a well-rounded developer.
Outside his professional experience, Bradley has created various full-stack mobile/web applications and implemented machine-learning models.
Bradley's interests extend to mentoring others, being an academic instructor from university to elementary levels. He finds joy in sharing knowledge and learning together.

patterns: Can Bradley take on new projects
responses: Bradley is available for work for 4 months before returning to his last term of study.
Bradley is available for a 4-month internship before returning to his studies.
If you have exciting projects, Bradley is ready to contribute! He is available for the next 4 months.
Bradley is a fourth-year student pursuing a Bachelors in Computer Science, with a minor in Data Science at the University of Ottawa.
His academic journey involves a strong focus on computer science and data science, preparing him for impactful contributions in the tech industry.
Bradley has worked on impactful projects, including implementing Google’s new passwordless authentication POC in the signin process for RBC’s Android mobile banking applications.
He also created a web application for Morgan Stanley with added standardized security features, containerized with Docker, packaged with a Helm Chart, and deployed onto a Kubernetes cluster.
Bradley's projects showcase a combination of cutting-edge technologies, cloud deployment, and experimental testing with in-house cloud technologies.

patterns: Tell me about Bradley's cloud workshops
responses: Bradley hosted workshops firmwide on how to deploy various department applications onto private cloud within the cloud department.
His teaching experience includes sharing knowledge on cloud technologies and deployment practices.
If you're interested in cloud technology, Bradley has valuable insights and experiences to offer.

patterns: Tell me about Bradley's database management
responses: Bradley has experience with database management at CMiC, focusing on data integration mappings between partnering companies.
His tasks involved using SQL queries to create, debug, and resolve data pipelines.
If you have questions about database management or SQL, Bradley is well-versed in these areas.

patterns: Tell me about Bradley's automation experience
responses: Bradley has experience with automation, including API testing with Postman at CMiC, writing Cypress tests at Morgan Stanley, and eliminating significant time during the production release process with his own Python script at RBC.
His automation skills cover a range of tasks, enhancing efficiency in various stages of development and testing.

patterns: Tell me about Bradley's personal projects
responses: Outside his professional experience, Bradley has created various full-stack mobile/web applications and implemented machine-learning models.
His pursuit of knowledge extends to personal projects, showcasing a diverse range of skills and interests.
If you're curious about Bradley's personal coding projects, feel free to ask for more details.

patterns: Tell me about Bradley's mentoring experience
responses: Bradley enjoys mentoring others with what he learns, being an academic instructor to those at a university level all the way down to elementary curiosity.
His mentoring experience spans a wide range, from university-level instruction to fostering elementary curiosity in coding.
If you're interested in mentorship or learning from Bradley, he's open to sharing his knowledge and experiences.

patterns: Tell me about Bradley's future goals
responses: Bradley strives to become a well-rounded developer, with special interests in exploring and contributing to incredible repositories built by talented people.
He finds satisfaction in being part of impressive solutions from their starting stages of development to production and enjoys teaching others.
If you're curious about Bradley's future goals and aspirations, feel free to ask for more details.
